ConfigurationSection.heading: Configuration
ConfigurationSection.errorInvalidPort: Invalid port number. Must be between 1 and 65535.

DatabasePage.invalidDatabaseNameAlert: Invalid database name. Please enter a valid name without path separators.
DatabasePage.errorCreatingDatabaseAlert: Error creating database. See console for details.
DatabasePage.confirmDeleteDatabase: Are you sure you want to delete the selected database? This action cannot be undone.
DatabasePage.recordingRateTooltip: Record a frame of training data every X ms

HeadsetTrackingCard.heading: Headset Tracking
HeadsetTrackingCard.title: Pitch and Yaw are relative to the gaze target

KalmanFilterConfigCard.smoothEyesTooltip: Toggle Smooth Eyes: When enabled, the Kalman filter smooths out small eye movement noise.
KalmanFilterConfigCard.smoothOpennessTooltip: Toggle Smooth Openness: When enabled, the Kalman filter smooths out small noise in eye openness data.
KalmanFilterConfigCard.opennessBasedTrustTooltip: Adjusts the trust given to gaze measurements based on eye openness. Lower openness reduces the trust, helping to minimize erratic tracking when eyes are partially closed.
KalmanFilterConfigCard.measurementNoiseTooltip: Expected variance in the measurements. Higher values reduce trust in each measurement. (Range: 2-8, default: 4)
KalmanFilterConfigCard.qLowTooltip: Process noise for small movements. Lower values yield smoother output but can slow response. (Range: 0.001-0.1, default: 0.01)
KalmanFilterConfigCard.qHighTooltip: Process noise for large movements. Higher values allow the filter to adapt faster to changes. (Range: 1-100, default: 10)
KalmanFilterConfigCard.thresholdGazeTooltip: The cutoff for distinguishing small noise from significant eye movement. (Range: 1-4, default: 2)
KalmanFilterConfigCard.thresholdOpennessTooltip: The cutoff for distinguishing small noise from significant openness changes. (Range: 0.01-0.1)
KalmanFilterConfigCard.blinkReleaseDelayTooltip: After a closed eye is detected, maintain the closed state for the specified number of milliseconds to account for tracking delay before reopening.

StartTrackingCard.splitYOutTooltip: Enabling this option sends the Y-axis output separately to /v2/EyeLeftY and /v2/EyeRightY. When disabled, the output is sent to /v2/EyeY.
StartTrackingCard.syncUpdateTooltip: Only updates tracking when both left and right eye frames have been refreshed since the last update.
StartTrackingCard.indEyesTooltip: When true, the model computes gaze for each eye separately. When false, both eyes are combined into one gaze direction.
StartTrackingCard.indEyelidsTooltip: When true, the model computes eyelid openness for each eye separately. When false, it combines both eyes into one value.
StartTrackingCard.eyeTrackingTooltip: If enabled, eye tracking data will be sent over OSC; if disabled, it will not be sent.
StartTrackingCard.eyelidTrackingTooltip: If enabled, eyelid tracking data will be sent over OSC; if disabled, it will not be sent.
